title: Dating App: Which One Are You?!!

data.title: Dating App: Which One Are You?!!
data.solution:
n = gets.to_i

photos = []
all_descriptions = []

n.times do
  photo_description = gets.chomp
  descriptions = photo_description.split(";")
  photos << descriptions
  all_descriptions += descriptions
end

valid_descriptions = all_descriptions.uniq.select{|desc| 
  photos.all?{|photo| photo.include?(desc) }
 }

if valid_descriptions.size == 1
  puts valid_descriptions.first
else
  puts "Catfish Alert!"
end
data.statement:
Your friend uses dating apps and is sick of having to go through multiple group photos to identify the account owner and has asked you to write a program to do it for them.

Given [[n]], then [[n]] [[photo_descriptions]] which describe all the people in the photo, identify the person who appears in all photos and output their description. If no single unique person appears in every photo, output {{Catfish Alert!}}.

testCases.title: Test 1
testCases.testIn:
2
Pale, tall, thin, with brown hair;Dark-skinned, short, thin, with brown hair
Dark-skinned, short, thin, with brown hair;Dark-skinned, tall, curvy, with brown hair
testCases.testOut: Dark-skinned, short, thin, with brown hair

data.constraints:
0 < [[n]] < 10
No more than 10 people described per photo
Assume a person's description can't change between photos and two people with the same description are the same person
Descriptions always consist of 4 parts {[[Skin tone]]{{,}} [[height]]{{,}} [[shape]]{{,}} [[hair colour]]}
data.stubGenerator:
read n:int
loop n read photoDescription:string(450)
write sole_common_description or Catfish Alert!

STATEMENT
Dating App: Which One Are You?!! by StepBack13
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[n]] for the number of [[photo_descriptions]] to compare.
<<Next [[n]] lines:>> A [[photo_description]] that describes each person in the photo, separated by {{;}}
data.outputDescription: <<1 line:>> The description of the only person who appears in all photos, or {{Catfish Alert!}} if there is no unique solution.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your friend uses dating apps and is sick of having to go through multiple group photos to identify the account owner and has asked you to write a program to do it for them.

Given n, then n photo_descriptions which describe all the people in the photo, identify the person who appears in all photos and output their description. If no single unique person appears in every photo, output Catfish Alert!.
Input
Line 1: An integer n for the number of photo_descriptions to compare.
Next n lines: A photo_description that describes each person in the photo, separated by ;
Output
1 line: The description of the only person who appears in all photos, or Catfish Alert! if there is no unique solution.
Constraints
0 < n < 10
No more than 10 people described per photo
Assume a person's description can't change between photos and two people with the same description are the same person
Descriptions always consist of 4 parts {Skin tone, height, shape, hair colour}
Example
Input
2
Pale, tall, thin, with brown hair;Dark-skinned, short, thin, with brown hair
Dark-skinned, short, thin, with brown hair;Dark-skinned, tall, curvy, with brown hair
Output
Dark-skinned, short, thin, with brown hair
